page.title: 04Pig farming near Cliffe
page.content: Pigs are usually kept in big cubicles with about 20 pigs in each. In summer when the weather is hot they are allowed to roll about in mud and dirt to keep them cool. When the sow is going to have piglets she is kept separate. When she has had her litter she is put in a farrowing pen. That has a fence to stop the sow lying on the piglets, but they can feed from her through the fence. They don't get any warmth from their mother, so they have a heater to keep them warm. The pigs can feed themselves from hoppers, and they can drink by pressing their snouts on a valve. Pigs are bred for pork or bacon. Porkers weigh about 45kg. at three months, and bacon pigs weigh about 65kg. at four or five months.
